definition: Xinhai Revolution (1911), which ended the Qing Dynasty
surname Xin

(of taste) hot or pungent/hard/laborious/suffering/eighth in order/eighth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/letter "H" or Roman "VIII" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 285°/octa
12th earthly branch: 9-11 p.m., 10th solar month (7th November-6th December), year of the Boar/ancient Chinese compass point: 330°
animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: Yuan Shikai quickly seized the fruits of the victory of the 1911 Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 袁世凯迅速篡夺了辛亥革命的胜利果实。

sentences.english: Chapter V is the decade before the Revolution of the civil commotion.
sentences.chinese: 第五章是对辛亥革命前十年间民变的思考。

sentences.english: Revolution of the Xinhai Year was the turning point to the national industry in Zhejiang.
sentences.chinese: 辛亥革命对浙江的民族工业来说是一个重要的转折点。

sentences.english: After the Revolution, in 1912, now replaced.
sentences.chinese: 辛亥革命后，于1912年改为现名。

sentences.english: In the mountain Donglu was the cemetery of revolutionary martyrs.
sentences.chinese: 在山的东麓是辛亥革命烈士陵园。

sentences.english: Celebrated as the 99th anniversary of the Xinhai Revolution and the Wuchang Uprising.
sentences.chinese: 兴祝辛亥革命成功结束了中国的帝制99周年纪念。

sentences.english: The spread of modern science presented a new situation during the Xinhai(1911 Chinese)Revolution period .
sentences.chinese: 辛亥革命时期近代科学在中国的传播出现了新的形势。

sentences.english: Drastic changes have taken place in China since 1911 Revolution broke out 100 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 辛亥革命一百年来，中华大地发生沧桑巨变。

sentences.english: In October 1911, China rose up in revolution.
A period of time before the Revolution of 1911 witnessed the participation of Chen Duxiu in the rebellious parties.
sentences.chinese: 陈独秀在辛亥革命前曾有过一段投身“乱党”的日子。

sentences.english: That's, success of the XIN-HAI Revolution benefits from the participation and support of women in Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 辛亥革命的成功得益于上海妇女的参与与支持。

sentences.english: Shikai quickly seized the fruits of the victory of the1911 Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 袁世凯迅速篡夺了辛亥革命的胜利果实。

sentences.english: The republic an revolution of 1911 led by Dr Sun Yat-sen.
sentences.chinese: 始于孙逸仙博士领导的辛亥革命。

sentences.english: It is the main stage that Zhao contributed himself to the revolution.
sentences.chinese: 这是赵声对辛亥革命作出贡献的主要阶段。

sentences.english: After the Revolution of 1911, China went through the vicissitudes of revolutionary turmoils.
sentences.chinese: 辛亥革命以后，中国经历了波澜壮阔的革命场景。

sentences.english: Yuan Shikai quickly seized the fruits of the victory of the1911 Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 袁世凯迅速篡夺了辛亥革命的胜利果实。

definition: Wuchang Uprising of October 10th, 1911, which led to Sun Yat-sen's Xinhai Revolution and the fall of the Qing dynasty
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
Campaign to Defend the Republic (1915) or National Protection War, a rebellion against the installation of Yuan Shikai 袁世凱|袁世凯[Yuan2 Shi4 kai3] as emperor
democratic revolution/bourgeois revolution (in Marx-Leninist theory, a prelude to the proletarian revolution)
Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
the Northern Warlords (1912-1927)
second revolution/campaign from 1913 of the provisional revolutionary government (under Sun Yat-sen and the Guomindang) against Yuan Shikai 袁世凱|袁世凯 and the Northern Warlords
May Fourth Movement/Chinese national renewal movement that started with 4th May 1919 protest against the Treaty of Versailles
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
National Protection War or Campaign to Defend the Republic (1915), a rebellion against the installation of Yuan Shikai 袁世凱|袁世凯[Yuan2 Shi4 kai3] as emperor
Manchu Restoration of 1917, an attempt by general 張勳|张勋[Zhanɡ1 Xun1] to reinstate the monarchy in China by restoring the abdicated emperor Puyi 溥儀|溥仪[Pu3 yi2] to the throne
National protection war or Campaign to defend the republic (1915), a rebellion against the installation of Yuan Shikai as emperor
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
opposing Yuan Shikai 袁世凱|袁世凯 in War of national protection 1915-1916/same as 反袁鬥爭|反袁斗争
the final years of the Ch'ing or Qing dynasty/China at the turn of the 20th century
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
